label: Code
description: Hand-writing code is something strongly philosophical -- organizing and categorizing thoughts, optimization in search of the ideal and constant falsification -- and unwittingly enriches life wisdom.

label: Icon
description: Small pictograms scienced-up in 1975, are a pleasant exercise in simplifying, organizing and distinct similiarizing. Of course, only with the properly geometric palette you will be able to build a path to the iconic nirvana.

label: Illustration
description: After the initial 20 years of drought, only the low-absorbing (boring) classes at Cultural Studies were able to open my head and hands for drawing. And it ended up with me loving black ink and human heads.

label: Interface
description: In the immense world of graphic design, there is probably nothing as actual, fascinating, full of life and vanishing theories, as interface design.

label: Lettering
description: Nothing beats the act of putting down letters on paper by your own hand, and the ability to build them with an accuracy of around 6000% is just a new level of pleasure.

label: Logo
description: The best thing about symbols is that the whole leviathan of information, doodle and mathematics meets in one procreative implosion and finishes with minimalistic message straight to the face.

label: Print
description: It is always nice to see the result of your own graphical work in the form of a physical artifact, and see how it behaves and changes under the influence of an ever-changing natural environment.
